sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve.
message_1: What is the exact Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve?
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension (D) = log(N) / log(1/s)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor.

For the Koch curve, at each iteration, each line segment is divided into four segments, each 1/3 the length of the original. So, N = 4 and s = 1/3.

D = log(4) / log(1/3)

D â‰ˆ 1.26186

The exact Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve is approximately 1.26186.
